name: n3-lang-exec
description: Language and in-editor reasoning features for N3 code.
author: w3c.n3

n3Execute.reasoner.description: Choose the N3 reasoner to execute N3 code

n3Execute.jen3Path.description: Path to the jen3 JAR file (download at https://github.com/william-vw/jen3/releases)

n3Execute.onlyShowInferences.description: Only show inferences and not the full deductive closure

n3Execute.extraEyeArguments.description: Provide additional command line arguments to eye.

n3Execute.postProcessEyeTraces.description: Post-process eye debug tracing (group by subject and filter duplicates).

n3LspServer.formatNamespaces.description: When formatting, also format prefix and base declarations by grouping them all at the top, using the '@' syntax, and sorting them alphabetically.

n3LspServer.namespacesFile.description:
Path to a JSON file with a single object that maps prefixes to their namepace URIs. This is used to suggest or directly insert namespaces when their prefix is found.
*** See https://github.com/william-vw/vscode-extension-n3/blob/main/data/namespaces.json for an example ***

n3LspServer.insertNamespaces.description: When found, insert a known namespace directly (Automatic) or suggest a code action (Suggest).

n3LspServer.autocompleteWithWellKnownVoc.description: Use terms from well-known vocabularies in auto-completion.

n3LspServer.vocabulariesFile.description:
Path to a JSON file with a single object that maps namespace URIs to text files with their terms. If the relevant auto-complete option is enabled, these terms will also be used in auto-completion.
*** See https://github.com/william-vw/vscode-extension-n3/blob/main/data/vocab/ for an example vocabularies.json file and files with predefined vocabulary terms. ***

scripts.postinstall: cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install && cd ..
